to be unable to make any sense of the matter/to be at a loss

lit. to be muddled in the brain (idiom); fig. excited and unable to act rationally/to go to one's head
lit. like a three-meter high monk, you can't rub his head (idiom)/fig. at a total loss

sentences.english: Teachers squeeze the knowledge into the heads of the students.
sentences.chinese: 老師將知識硬塞進學生的頭腦中。

sentences.english: Success will not turn my head.
sentences.chinese: 勝利不會讓我頭腦發昏。

sentences.english: The new nation needs a modern-minded ruler.
sentences.chinese: 這個新興的國家需要有現代頭腦之統治者。

sentences.english: They didn't develop those habits of mind by following mandated curricula.
sentences.chinese: 他們沒有開發這些頭腦的思維習慣強制遵循課程。

sentences.english: All you need is an open mind and an hour each day.
sentences.chinese: 你所需要的只是一個開放的頭腦和每天一小時的時間。

sentences.english: How do you stay levelheaded in the middle of a bubble?
sentences.chinese: 在泡沫時期你怎麼保持清醒的頭腦？

sentences.english: Six light-minded girls are losing their passports and money on their way to Ibiza.
sentences.chinese: 六個頭腦簡單的女孩在去伊比薩的路上丟了護照和錢。

sentences.english: The Conductor's analytical mind helps her to ensure that no detail goes unconsidered.
sentences.chinese: 售票員的分析的頭腦幫助她，以確保所有細節都幾。

sentences.english: However, that implies that ancient China may loom larger in my mind than it should compared to modern China.
sentences.chinese: 不過這可能意味着我頭腦裏的中國古多於今。

sentences.english: Really there is economic brains, yet estimate also together here be one performing in collusion because malign purpose of commander.
sentences.chinese: 的確有經濟頭腦，但估計也同這裏當官的狼狽爲奸。

sentences.english: Turned free and easy of go away, let figure burger in your mind.
sentences.chinese: 轉身灑脫的走開，讓你的頭腦中留下美圖漢堡的印象。

sentences.english: Don't let his congratulations go to your head.
sentences.chinese: 不要讓他的祝詞衝昏你的頭腦。

sentences.english: Offer the invisble room in your heart and mind.
sentences.chinese: 在你的內心和頭腦中爲本性提供一個空間。

sentences.english: I didn't know what he prayed but I had thought in my mind .
sentences.chinese: 我不知道他許了什麼願，但我在頭腦裏有想法。

definition: immediately/at once/at that moment/at the moment
attitude (of the heart)/state of one's psyche/way of thinking/mentality
